intro: Ludwigia bertonii, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers, which bloom in clusters at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a glossy appearance, adding to its ornamental value. Ludwigia bertonii is popular in aquatic and bog gardens due to its vibrant color and adaptability to moist environments.
